fields.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
fields.author: Harper Lee
fields.description: The unforgettable novel of a childhood in a sleepy Southern town and the crisis of conscience that rocked it.

fields.title: The Da Vinci Code
fields.author: Dan Brown
fields.description: A thrilling mystery involving symbology, secret societies, and religious history.

fields.title: Dune
fields.author: Frank Herbert
fields.description: A sweeping sci-fi epic set on the desert planet Arrakis, filled with politics, religion, and giant sandworms.

fields.title: The Diary of a Young Girl
fields.author: Anne Frank
fields.description: The haunting diary of a young Jewish girl hiding from the Nazis during World War II.

fields.title: Pride and Prejudice
fields.author: Jane Austen
fields.description: A classic tale of love and values in the class-conscious England of the late 18th century.

fields.title: The Pillars of the Earth
fields.author: Ken Follett
fields.description: An epic tale of ambition, anarchy, and absolute power set against the sprawling medieval canvas of 12th-century England.

fields.title: The Hunger Games
fields.author: Suzanne Collins
fields.description: In a dark vision of the near future, a terrifying reality TV show is taking place.

fields.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
fields.author: Stieg Larsson
fields.description: A gripping mystery combining murder investigation, family saga, love story, and financial intrigue.

fields.title: Steve Jobs
fields.author: Walter Isaacson
fields.description: The definitive biography of Apple co-founder Steve Jobs, based on exclusive interviews with Jobs and over 100 family members, friends, and colleagues.

fields.title: The Alchemist
fields.author: Paulo Coelho
fields.description: A mystical story about following your dreams, combining magic, wisdom, and wonder.
